title: I am a little concerned about my sister‚Äôs relationship with her boyfriend.

He always asks her who the person is and what they were talking about. Today, I was on FaceTime with my sister while she went out to lunch with her friend Sarah. Her boyfriend texted her asking where she was and what she was doing. She told him she was having lunch with Sarah, but he still got mad at her. It felt weird how he reacted like that, as if it was wrong for her to hang out with her friend. Is this normal? Does this seem like a red flag?

title: How can I build a good relationship with my brother who is an alcoholic?

I try to be supportive but he does not listen or respond well when I offer help. If anything it pushes him away even more.   I am worried about him because he will eventually die from alcohol related health problems if he continues down this path.  What are some things that I can do to improve our relationship without enabling his addiction?  Any advice would be appreciated!

title: My first time doing an acid trip.
self_text: When I was in high school, I went to a friend's house and we were gonna smoke weed for the first time, but his older brother walked in on us, so he told us that he would give us some "magic paper". At first, I thought it was just a joke because his brother always pranked us, but when he handed us two small pieces of blotter paper, I knew something was up. It turned out they were LSD, which we had never tried before. We both ate them at the same time, and after about half an hour we started feeling weird. Everything was getting really colorful and moving around, and we were laughing hysterically at nothing. We ended up going outside and running around in circles, staring at the stars and trees, and generally having a good time. But then things started to get intense. The colors got even brighter, and everything started warping and changing shape. I felt like I was floating above my body, and I could see myself from a third-person perspective. It was terrifying, but also incredibly fascinating. I spent the next few hours trying to make sense of what was happening, but it was impossible. Everything was too overwhelming and chaotic. Eventually, I managed to calm down and focus on my breathing, and slowly the effects began to wear off. By the end of the night, I was exhausted and emotionally drained, but also strangely grateful for the experience. It taught me a lot about myself and the world around me, and it made me appreciate the beauty and wonder of life. Now, I still occasionally take psychedelics, but I always do so responsibly and with respect for their power.

The worst part is that I used to be a good looking guy in high school and college and now it seems all the girls who would give me the time of day back then are either married or with someone else.  I know people say "don't compare yourself to others" but it's hard when you see everyone around you getting what they want in life while you are stuck doing nothing but work and play video games at home.   Is there any hope for me?

title: Why does my dad hate me?
self_text: I am a pretty normal kid, I play sports, get good grades and have a lot of friends. My mom is amazing, she‚Äôs always been there for me. She has cancer, so things are hard right now but we manage to make it work. It seems like everything I do annoys my dad, I can never do anything right in his eyes. He hates my friends, he thinks they're all losers, even though they're really cool people. He yells at me for no reason, sometimes when I haven't done anything wrong. When I try to talk to him about how he makes me feel, he just says "You need to grow up" or "You don't understand." I love my dad, but I just don't know what to do anymore. I want a relationship with him, but I don't think that's possible. Is there something I can do to fix this? Or am I doomed to be forever hated by my own father?

The story is about Spider-Man getting pulled in by his villains (like Venom, Mysterio, Vulture) who all want to turn Peter Parker evil so that he can become their ally. They try to take advantage of Spidey‚Äôs emotional state after MJ breaks up with him, as they are aware that she holds great importance in his life. Then, Doctor Strange comes along to help Peter get back on track, but his own past mistakes come back to haunt him as he must also deal with the consequences of using dark magic.  I think it would be really awesome if they could bring back Tobey Maguire and Andrew Garfield to team up with Tom Holland, making it a multiverse Spider-Man event. It would show how far Spidey has come since being a high school student, while still holding onto his sense of humor and compassion. But I am not sure how to even start pitching such a script to someone like Kevin Feige or Sony. Do you guys think this sounds like something that could work? How do I even begin trying to make this happen?!

title: AITA for telling my friend I think she is a bad mother?
self_text: My (26F) friend (27F) had her first baby 3 months ago. She has always been a bit of a party animal, and was not particularly excited about being pregnant in the first place. Since having the baby, she still goes out to bars almost every weekend with her friends. Her husband works long hours and is often at work until late so it's usually just her taking care of the baby.  I went to visit her last week and when I arrived, she told me she was going out to dinner with some friends. I asked who was watching the baby and she said her husband would be home around 8pm. She left around 6pm and didn‚Äôt come back until after midnight. When I asked why it took so long, she said they were bar hopping.  I lost it. I said that I thought what she did was irresponsible and that she shouldn‚Äôt be leaving a 3 month old alone with a dad who worked all day. She got mad at me and told me to mind my own business.  I feel like I was right to say something but now our friendship feels strained. I am worried about the baby and I don't know if I should have gotten involved.  AITA?

title: I think I am a lesbian and I don't know what to do.
self_text: Hi, so I am a teenager who is attracted to girls but I'm in denial because my parents are very conservative. I keep on telling myself that it's just a phase or that I will get over it once I find the right boy. I really don't want to come out to them yet as they would not understand at all and might disown me. My friends also don't know about it and I can't seem to bring myself to tell them. All of this has been going on for around three years now and I am starting to feel very depressed. It feels like I am living two different lives: one where I pretend to be straight and one where I am myself. Every time I try to talk to someone about it, I end up shutting down because I'm afraid of being judged. Has anyone else experienced something similar? What did you do to cope with your feelings and how did you eventually come out? Any advice would be appreciated!

title: The 2015-2016 Thunder were cursed
self_text: If the Thunder had an NBA finals, I would've been a fan. But as it turns out, they will be remembered as a team that got screwed over by injuries and refs. I mean, you can go back to the series against the Warriors in 2016, when Draymond Green was suspended for Game 5 due to flagrant foul points and he could've played in Games 7 if they had won Game 5. That's like if LeBron James gets ejected from Game 4 of the 2013 Finals, but he can still play in Game 7 if they win.  I'm not saying that would have guaranteed the Thunder winning the series, but I think it is fair to say that they were robbed of a chance to win a championship because of the referees. Then you look at the injury to Kevin Durant, which basically ended their chances of making another run at a title. It's just so frustrating to see such a talented team get thwarted by circumstances beyond their control. I mean, what could they do? They couldn't control the refs or prevent Kevin Durant from getting injured. All they could do was keep playing hard and try to make the most of their situation. And they did. They made it to the Western Conference Finals in 2016 without KD, and then they lost to the Warriors in seven games. I know some people might say that the Warriors were simply better, but I disagree. I think the Thunder were a legitimate contender, and they deserved a better fate. It's just sad to see how things turned out for them. I really wanted to see them win a championship.  It's especially sad because they had such a bright future. With Russell Westbrook, Kevin Durant, and Serge Ibaka all in their prime, they were poised to dominate the league for years to come. But now, with Durant gone and Westbrook traded away, they're no longer the same team. They're still good, but they're not great anymore.  I guess that's just the way things go sometimes. Sometimes, even the best teams get unlucky. But it doesn't make it any easier to watch.  I think the Thunder are cursed. And I don't think they'll ever break the curse.

title: My name is not "you"
self_text: I‚Äôve been using Reddit for a long time now, and have never had an issue with people addressing me in the second person. However, recently, it seems like so many people are doing it to me on my posts and comments, and frankly, it's getting annoying!  I understand that Reddit has become more popular over the years, and thus there are more new users who may not know how to address someone appropriately. But still, why do they insist on saying ‚Äúyou‚Äù when referring to me? It just feels so condescending, especially when they say things like ‚ÄúYou should‚Ä¶‚Äù or ‚ÄúYou need to‚Ä¶‚Äù.   I really don‚Äôt get why people feel the need to tell others what to do all the time. If you want to help someone, offer advice instead of telling them what to do! It‚Äôs much more respectful, and it makes the recipient feel valued.  Sorry for the rant, but I needed to vent about this somewhere. Thanks for reading!

title: AITA for getting a dog when my husband does not want a pet?
self_text: I have wanted to get a dog since I was little but my husband is very much against it as he has been bitten by a dog before and doesn‚Äôt like the responsibility of having another thing that needs care. He loves cats though, so we got two cats! But I still feel bad that I haven‚Äôt had a dog. We were talking about pets again today because I saw an adorable puppy online. My husband said no again, but then suggested we foster. Fostering is great because we can help dogs in need while giving me the opportunity to see if having a dog suits us. So I agreed, but only if we could choose a smaller breed that would be easy to manage (I am small too). Then he made some comment about how I don‚Äôt listen to him. Why does he always do this???!!! He suggests something, I agree with it, and then he gets mad at me anyway. It is such a pattern with him. It makes me feel like he is just trying to start a fight. He says I didn‚Äôt listen because I chose a small dog, even though he literally told me to pick a small dog. I was so frustrated that I just left the room. Was I being unreasonable here?

self_text: I am trying to find the area of an equilateral triangle that has sides equal to 6cm, but I am unsure how to do it. If someone could please explain what I should do step by step I would be grateful.

title: Do you think I'm a loser?
self_text: I am a pretty normal guy, but I have no friends and I feel like everyone is better than me, even the people that I think are annoying or bad at life. I feel like it would be so nice to just fall asleep and not wake up. Is there any reason why anyone should want to spend time with someone like me?

title: AITA for wanting my friend to pay me back?
self_text: My friend and I have been friends since freshman year of high school, but we don't hang out a lot anymore because we both go to different colleges now. Last summer when he was visiting the area, we went out to eat with another friend. He said he would Venmo me his half, but it has been over a month and he still hasn‚Äôt. I texted him about it two weeks ago, and he told me he had no money right now, so I told him that I understood, as long as he paid me back in a week or two. That time frame came and went, so I asked again today. He got mad at me and said I shouldn‚Äôt ask him about it if I know he doesn‚Äôt have any money. Then he said I should just let it go. I am upset because $20 is not an insane amount of money to owe someone. It feels like he wants me to just give up on getting my money back. So AITA for wanting my friend to pay me back?

title: AITA for refusing to help my coworker who is in a bad place?
self_text: I‚Äôm (31F) working at an office job as an administrative assistant. My coworker, ‚ÄúBen‚Äù (28M), has been struggling with depression and anxiety lately. He's taken some time off work but has come back now.  I am generally pretty friendly with Ben, we get along well enough and he's always helpful when asked. But recently he's been more withdrawn than usual and seems really down. The other day, he came up to me while I was busy and asked if I could talk with him about his problems. At first I said sure, but then he started talking for like 45 minutes straight and it turned out that he just wanted someone to vent to. It wasn‚Äôt a problem at the moment because I had nothing urgent to do, so I listened. However, he did not take any advice or even acknowledge anything I said! It was just constant complaining. And since then, he keeps asking me for these talks whenever he sees me.   I understand that people go through tough times and need support from their friends and family. But I don‚Äôt think I am qualified to be anyone‚Äôs therapist and I can‚Äôt keep spending my work hours listening to someone complain without getting anywhere. I told Ben I couldn‚Äôt help him anymore, and suggested he seek professional help.  He got upset with me and accused me of being insensitive. Now everyone at work thinks I‚Äôm a terrible person.  AITA?

title: My new car is a dog!
self_text: I‚Äôve had my new car for about 3 weeks now and it keeps wanting to play fetch when I go to drive anywhere. I can‚Äôt believe how well the previous owner trained this thing, but I don‚Äôt think they ever taught him how to follow directions.

title: I think that the amount of money spent on food is not worth it, and I would rather spend it on something else.
self_text: I am a student who lives in the dorms. The meal plan costs around $4000 per year, but the average cost of groceries for students at my school is about $2500. I'm wondering if the meal plan is really worth the extra money, or if I should just buy my own groceries.  I know that some people say the meal plan is convenient, but I don't mind cooking myself. I also know that some people say the meal plan is healthier than eating out, but I eat pretty healthy already.  I'm just trying to figure out what makes sense for me.

title: I'm so happy to finally have an excuse to say "I told you so"
self_text: This is the third time in my life where people around me are surprised at how a thing turned out and they all had said that it would not happen, and all three times I had said it will.  So here goes...   In January of 2017, a friend asked if Donald Trump could win the election. At that point he was polling behind Hillary Clinton by roughly 3% nationally, but his approval ratings were still falling (and continue to fall). It was then that I said, ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt count him out because of the way our country is trending.‚Äù He laughed and said something like, ‚ÄúAre you saying someone who says things like ‚ÄòI like people who were captured and tortured‚Äô can be President?!‚Äù And I just shrugged and said, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs possible, because people are angry and frustrated with the government.‚Äù   Then last year, another friend asked if the Kansas City Chiefs could beat the San Francisco 49ers in Super Bowl LIV. I said, ‚ÄúYes, because Patrick Mahomes is playing at a level no other QB has ever reached before.‚Äù He laughed and said, ‚ÄúBut their defense isn‚Äôt very good‚Äù and I replied, ‚ÄúThat doesn‚Äôt matter when your QB can make magic happen every play.‚Äù The Chiefs won 31-20.   And now‚Ä¶ I just said to my wife yesterday, ‚ÄúI think this new COVID variant is going to be really bad.‚Äù She scoffed and said, ‚ÄúNo way, we‚Äôve been doing great! We don‚Äôt need masks anymore.‚Äù Well, guess what?! Today the CDC is recommending everyone wear masks indoors again.   I swear, I‚Äôm starting to feel like Nostradamus or something! üòÇ

title: I'm sorry for my loss
self_text: This is something that's been on my mind a lot, and it feels like no matter what I do or say, the sadness won't go away.  I think about her every day, but it's just not enough. It doesn't fill the void. I miss her laugh, her smile, her touch... everything about her.  I know I need to move on with my life, but it's so hard when all I want to do is relive those moments again.  I feel lost and alone without her.  Is there anyone else who has gone through this? How did you cope? What advice can you give me?  Thank you for listening.  (This is a tough one)

title: I‚Äôm getting a new car on Monday and so excited!
self_text: Finally got around to making the decision of my first car. It's been a long journey but it finally paid off.  I hope that she will treat me well :D

title: "I think I'm losing my mind"
self_text: so i have a friend who is an alcoholic, and he loves to tell me how it affects his family.  and then every time i try to talk about what happened in the past, he says that it doesn‚Äôt matter because ‚Äúi don‚Äôt remember‚Äù which makes me feel like he thinks I‚Äôm stupid.  he has no intention of going to therapy or getting help, but expects me to listen to him complain about his life.  am i being unreasonable for wanting space from him?  the thing is, i love him, but i can‚Äôt keep having these conversations with him without feeling like a punching bag.

title: I am getting married to my girlfriend in the end of September, but my best friend is having a baby at that time, so he won't be able to attend. He asked me if we could postpone it for him, and I said no because it would ruin all our plans (we already booked everything), and now he has been distant from me ever since. What should I do?
self_text: My best friend and I have been friends since we were kids, and he has always been there for me. We are both in our late twenties, and he is getting married soon. As far as I know, his girlfriend is due on the same day as the wedding. When he told me about his girlfriend being pregnant, I was happy for him, but also worried about how this would affect our friendship. The thing is, I am getting married too, and my wedding is planned for the end of September. I had originally wanted to get married sooner, but we couldn't find a venue until now. It took us a long time to book everything, and we were really excited about it. I told him about my wedding date when he told me about his girlfriend's pregnancy, and he was very supportive. However, he recently asked me if we could postpone our wedding so that he can attend. I explained to him that we had already booked everything, and postponing it would ruin all our plans. He seemed disappointed, and now he has been distant from me ever since. I feel bad for him, but I don't think it's fair for him to ask me to change my wedding plans just so he can attend. What should I do?

title: What is the most embarrassing thing to say during a job interview?
self_text: I've never been on an interview but my friends are always telling me their horror stories and it makes me nervous for when i finally have one. I heard someone ask what they would do if their boss was wrong. That's just... not good, right?  Any other answers that would get you immediately rejected?

title: I think there is a big difference between the original and the remake, but that doesn't mean the remake isn't good.
self_text: I watched The Last of Us Part II remake as someone who never played the original. And it was an amazing game. But that doesn't mean I have to pretend like the story changes weren't huge. It wasn't necessary for them to be so divisive. They could've just had Joel die in a different way without him being tortured by Abby. That would still give us the same emotional impact without changing the entire story. I know people will disagree with me, but I am confident in my opinion.

title: How long did it take you to find a good therapist?
self_text: I'm really struggling with my mental health and have been going to therapy for about a year now but haven't found a therapist that I feel particularly connected to, or like is actually helping me much. I'm starting to lose hope and wonder if I'll ever find someone who works well with me. Did anyone else experience something similar? And how long did it end up taking you to find a good therapist? Any advice would be greatly appreciated!

title: I got my first job!
self_text: So, i've been trying to find a job in the software engineering field since January and it was getting me down. But then i applied for an internship at my university and i had an interview today and they said i could have the job! Now i just need to wait until HR gets back to me with some details about salary and work schedule but i am so happy right now that something is finally going my way.  I know its not a full time job or anything super exciting but i think this will be great experience to help me build my resume and hopefully get a better job after college. I just wanted to share this little win with you guys. Thanks for all of the support during these stressful few months, you guys are awesome!

title: How to get a good job after graduating with a computer science degree?
self_text: I'm an incoming senior at university, and am starting to think about my future. I have a CS degree with GPA of 3.84/4.0 (so far), but I don't really have any internship experience. So how do I land a good software engineering job after graduation? I'm currently thinking about applying for jobs in summer or winter internships, but I don't know if it's too late.  I also read some advice online saying that the best way to find a job is through referrals from employees working at tech companies. But how do you go about getting these referrals? Do you just reach out to people on LinkedIn and ask them for help? Or are there other ways? Any advice would be appreciated!

title: PSA - if you want to go to the bathroom at a concert, pick an aisle seat and don't be afraid to walk over people to get out.
self_text: I went to see harry styles last night and my bladder was about to burst but there were 10 people in front of me. I asked them all politely to let me through so I could use the restroom, and they just kept telling me "you should have gone before".  I then walked over everyone to get to the restroom. It's not fun being stuck between 10 people who can't do basic human decency.  If you need to pee, please move over. I had to miss half a song but it was better than peeing my pants on the floor.

title: i just wanna be a human
self_text: I'm a non-binary, polyamorous, demisexual person in my mid twenties and i don't know what the hell to do with myself or where i want to go in life.  I've been struggling for years now but its all coming up at once because i think i might have finally met someone who understands me/i can fall in love with?  But then again it could all be in my head and im overthinking things as usual.  Any advice is appreciated, even if its just "its okay" or "youre not alone."

title: I'm gonna be a dad in about 5 months, and I have no idea what to do
self_text: So here are some things I want to ask the community because I'm really struggling with this.   I feel like my wife is going through all of this alone while I'm just standing around watching.  She seems so angry all the time and that scares me.   We're doing marriage counseling but it hasn't seemed to help much yet.   I'm not sure how to talk to her anymore without setting off an explosion.  It's been hard to find time for ourselves too and I miss our intimacy.   But she doesn't seem interested at all.   What am I missing? How can I help? What should I expect?
